docs.lead_paragraph: After six months on strike, 220 workers at one of the largest nursing homes in the Bronx were feeling relieved, delighted but still somewhat angry when they began returning to work on Thursday morning.

headline.main: Striking Nursing Home Workers Return to Work

docs.abstract: Employees of a large Bronx nursing home returned to work after a federal judge ordered the nursing home to resume paying the workers' health insurance premiums.
docs.snippet: Employees of a large Bronx nursing home returned to work after a federal judge ordered the nursing home to resume paying the workers' health insurance premiums.

docs.lead_paragraph: The local newspapers all weighed in today on Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg's proposal to place wind turbines atop the city's skyscrapers and bridges, as well as off the coastline of Queens and Brooklyn. The New York Times's assessment is that it would be complicated and expensive and barely begin to meet the growth in demand for electricity that is expected in the coming years,in part because skyscrapers would have to be designed or retrofitted at great cost to accommodate the extra weight of the turbines and insurers would have to be persuaded to cover them. And New York is not a particularly windy city, so a few buildings facing New York Harbor might be the only sites that make sense.
docs.abstract: Also in Morning Buzz: the mistakes that preceded the deaths of two firefighters in the former Deustche Bank building; news from Albany; and more headlines from papers in the region.
docs.snippet: Also in Morning Buzz: the mistakes that preceded the deaths of two firefighters in the former Deustche Bank building; news from Albany; and more headlines from papers in the region.

docs.lead_paragraph: Medicare officials’ 2006 statements that they had reduced the number of fraudulent and improper claims were misleading, a draft report says.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Nikkei average slid 2.7 percent to hit a one-month low on Tuesday as exporters such as Canon and bank shares were battered after jitters about the health of the financial system in the United States re-emerged.

headline.main: Japanese Financial Stocks Tumble in Early Trading
